newsitem.title: GERMANY: Rhoen-Klinik 96 group net rises 30.2 pct.
newsitem.headline: Rhoen-Klinik 96 group net rises 30.2 pct.

text.p: German health care group Rhoen-Klinik AG said on Wednesday its 1996 group net income rose 30.2 percent to 46.6 million marks.
The company also said it expected 1997 sales to climb to 855 million marks, from 792 million marks last year, and that 1997 profit would rise accordingly.
Rhoen-Klinik also proposed unchanged dividends of 1.45 marks per preferred share and 1.35 marks per common share, the company said at a news conference.
According to German accounting standards, Rhoen-Klink's reported 1996 profit of 7.15 marks per share, compared with 4.77 per share in 1995.
Cash flow in 1996 also increased 33.2 percent to 142.4 million marks.
The company's preferred shares closed floor trading on Wednesday at 215 marks, falling 7.50 marks, or three percent while the German blue-chip DAX index slipped 0.6 percent to 3,573.69.
